text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5e8325084c0a5c00043c37f2|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-25" to "peter-and-smarth"
name: peter-and-smarth

text:
Hey Smarth, please meet Peter your incredible E-Mentor we've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or penny-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi Smarth.

Good to meet you. Look forward to hearing what you're interested in finding out about.

Thanks

Hi Peter
I am Smarth and I study in Villiers Sixth Form (year 12).
The A-levels i chose are computer science, maths,physics and italian. 
I want you to help me and tell me how you have started the business.
Why did you set up the business in first place??
Was the main reason profit or passion??
 
Tell me more about yourself (what did you study ?? And why ??

Thank you for taking the time to mentor me I really appreciate it.

Hi Smarth

My career history is quite varied, For my A-Levels, which was a long time ago I did Business Studies, English, History and General Studies. I then did a Business Education degree as at one point I planned to teach Business Studies, or at least have that as something to fall back on if my creative endeavours didn't succeed.

I didn't found the business I run, I was brought in 8 years ago to help run it, as two companies had merged. Last January I became the Managing Director. I spent 10 years working in radio, ended up  as a radio station MD before moving to VFX/Motion Design/Animation 10 years ago, so I've spent half my career in each industry.

What that has given me is an insight into clients, running a business and managing a team. The profit or passion question is an interesting one, I think the two can go hand in hand. I always say if you chase the money you will usually not make much as your decisions will be short term and purely motivated by revenue. However if you are passionate about what you do, that passion will create create work which you can charge more for, ultimately giving you more profit than if you just went after the ££.

Thanks

Pete

Hi peter
What is the name of the company?? And what services/products do you sell????
What were the two companies that merged????
What is the role of a managing director???
Do you think I can do business studies in university without doing it as a level??

Thanks
Smarth

Bait Studio is the company I run. we do motion design and visual effects.

The companies that merged were Bait (motion design) and Red Wire (VFX).

A Managing Director runs the whole business, develops strategy and manages the people. As we are  a small company also generate new business and deal with clients.

I would image that you could, if that's what interests you.

Thanks

Pete

Hi peter
How do you approach to an investor when you are trying to make them invest in to the company??
How do you advertise the services you offer?? What do you take into account???
Can you talk more about your business??? Where is your company settled?
Is it an ecommerce company (work from home) or do you have an office/building??
Thanks
Smarth
